guidelines: Remain humble and kind above all else.
To develop your full creative abilities, first develop your skills step-by-step, over time.
Exercise your body, your mind, and your emotions.
Balance your analytical abilities with creative intuition.
questions: Do I let self-doubt or insecurity stop me?
Do I follow a gradual step-by-step process to reach my goals?
Have I explored the full range of my creative capacities?
Have I worked through early family issues?

advice: Forms of meditation, relaxation, suppleness training, and free movement, such as the martial arts of aikido or t'ai chi, are all useful-as is anything that teaches them to blend, flow, and accept rather than resist.

Forms of physical skill training, such as dance or martial arts, offer special benefits because they help turn rigid strength into supple, dynamic power and give 31/4s and 13/4s a direct experience of following a process and experiencing improvement over time.
These individuals thrive on exercise and particularly enjoy social sports.
A balanced, low-fat diet serves as a good foundation.
negative: Mental stress or resistance can create physical as well as energetic constipation and can compromise the immune system.
Vulnerable at "foundation points," such as ankles, knees, thighs, and hips.
positive: The strength of 31/4s and 13/4s, amplified by creative energy, gives them robust appeal, ruggedness, and resistance to everyday illness.
Their body type tends to be either wide-bodied and bottom-heavy or solidly athletic, depending largely upon genetics and lifestyle; either way, they are basically strong.

opportunities: success in business, advising, or counseling in real estate or investments

advice: Acknowledge their insecurity to themselves and others to achieve a new level of authenticity.
Confess their sensitive or insecure qualities to find they have less to defend, less to prove, and fewer people they have to impress, leading to a greater sense of inner solidity.
See the relationship as a process of ups and downs, entailing learning, maturation, and mutual support, appreciating it as a challenging form of spiritual training rather than "the same old thing."
Work through the "nonsexual" issues of self-doubt, insecurity, and lack of commitment.
negative: Difficulty staying put or making real emotional commitments.
May leave the back door open even when committed.
Past experiences of abuse or their subconscious resistance and physical tension may get in the way of satisfying sexual expression.
positive: Easy sociability attracts many friends and admirers.
Tend to be gregarious, family-oriented, and generally relaxed with people.
Strong, vital, earthy, and creative lovers.

advice: Remember that "overnight successes" can take years-and many small steps-to achieve.
negative: Impatience can lead to jumping from job to job without putting down roots.
Unrealistic expectations of success without putting in the work.
positive: Find success in a variety of careers due to their creative and expressive energies and sound analytical abilities.
Practical creativity, developed over time, leads to the security they desire.
